document_name: UN Support for Strengthening Disaster Preparedness

outputs.output_descr:
The Kyrgyz Republic is highly exposed to disasters. Landslides, mudflows and floods are major hazards, with 200-300 events every year. Seismic activity results in more than 3,000 earthquakes registered annually. In addition, the country is at high risk for manmade disasters from the industrial and nuclear waste dumps left over from the Soviet past. 
The main objective of the project is to support the coordination activities of the Disaster Response Coordination Unit (DRCU) Secretariat in further strengthening cooperation and coordination for disaster preparedness and response between the donors, local and international organizations, NGOs, UN organizations and the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic.

project_descr: The main objective of the project is to support the coordination activities of the Disaster Response Coordination Unit Secretariat
project_title: UN Support for Strengthening Disaster Preparedness
